meanings.definition: To apply a new coat of varnish to (something).
meanings.sent1: She revarnishes the old table to make it shiny again.
meanings.sent2: He revarnishes the wooden floor every year to protect it.
meanings.sent3: The painter revarnishes the chair, making it look brand new.
meanings.sent4: The artist revarnishes the canvas, bringing out the vibrant colors.
meanings.sent5: Mom revarnishes the antique dresser, making it gleam beautifully.

meanings.definition: To restore or renew the appearance of (something) by applying a new coat of varnish.
meanings.sent1: The carpenter revarnishes the front door to make it look fresh.
meanings.sent2: They revarnished the deck to give it a new lease on life.
meanings.sent3: After the storm, he revarnishes the fence, making it stand out.
meanings.sent4: The artist revarnishes the painting, reviving its original beauty.
meanings.sent5: Dad revarnishes the boat, making it shine in the sun.
